reviews.review_text: as someone whos messed with and has had several different brands of headsets, Logitech has always done me good. i dont know why there are so many negative reviews on this headset. it doubles as a gaming headset and headphones, battery life on the registered LogiTech pc software says i have a max 31 hours of battery life. it was easy to set up, sound quality is great! i give it a 10/10 would recommend!

reviews.title: My Logitech G535 review
reviews.review_text: These fit perfectly around my ear so it's a nice comfort feel and the pads are very soft and headset is overall very light which is very convenient on the neck. Sound is amazing on it for competitive gaming. It has adjustable volume for better hearing. it is wireless so the switch from my previous wired headset to this one is a great. Price is good for the sale and without sale definitely worth the money.

reviews.title: Works great for Microsoft Teams, good audio qualit
reviews.review_text: I wanted a headset I could use for work with Microsoft Teams and also listen to music with both at work and at home. It works great for both purposes. The range, however, is a bit disappointing as I lose signal in the next room over in my house. Bluetooth headsets will do you much better if range is a concern. Ergonomically these are also great. Very light and they don't make my hears hurt like many other over-the-ear headphones.

reviews.title: Watch what you cancel
reviews.review_text: The first one came with a damaged dongle and would not work. But since Walmart did not cancel the order I first had when I ordered another one I got and paid for two. Luckily the second one was awesome! I returned the broken one to the store for a refund.

reviews.title: Amazing Headset
reviews.review_text: Ive tried so so many headsets. Big brands like Hyperx, Corsair. I always ran into the problem of never being heard clearly. This is the first headset where I can actually be heard in calls without being put at max volume. The battery lasts forever. Its comfortable and lite

reviews.title: Logitech Headset
reviews.review_text: Fantastic headset. Excellent sound quality with directional hearing. About 20ft of range before it starts to cut out. Battery will easily last a week on a single charge for me. I generally game around 5 hours. Comfortable and Lightweight. Easy to connect, comes with a USB Wireless Adapter.
love them a bunch just wish the audio was a bit louder with a bass boost option for specific games but definitely worth the price the battery life is long and still sounds crisp
Used it twice for about 6 hours each time. The headset worked very well. Paired to my PS4 effertlessly.

reviews.title: Temporary Replacement
reviews.review_text: Did you break your headset and need a new one ASAP? Do you only use your headset occasionally? Well look no further than this garbage thing! Does what you need it to do at the bare minimum! Use this one temporarily and then buy yourself a Turtle Beach or an officially licensed headset, okay? Don't use this permanently.

reviews.title: Good but lacks important features

Got these as a birthday gift and I absolutely love them! They're so good that my son also requested the same ones for his birthday!
The headset is really good at all, but it should really be specified it's not for Xbox, I bought the headset thinking it was compatible but it's not.

reviews.title: Great headset for a great price.
reviews.review_text: This headset has good quality sound, while also remaining light weight and comfortable. I was surprised about how much better it feels to not have a heavy set of headphones. It was ready to use out of the box, all I had to do was plug in the usb bluetooth connector and charge the headset while I used it. The battery lasts for a few days on a single charge. Would recommend.

reviews.title: but it wont regret
reviews.review_text: Comfy to wear, great battery life, and great speakers/mic, worth it also can charge while using.
simple to use! with some easy to navigate features for beginners

reviews.title: Bought for a gift.
reviews.review_text: Bought this for my older child - shes had them for awhile now and says she loves them so I'm guessing its a great item..!!

reviews.title: Does its job, but lacking.
reviews.review_text: Pros: -Durable headstrap. You can twist this thing any which way. -Lightweight. Doesn't press down head. Cons: - Lacks adjustment. It uses a suspension band instead of sliding ear cups, and the band only has two possible positions. Plus earcups are stationary and do not rotate. -Sound quality. Unbalanced and very slightly muffled. Other features tend to fall to preference wuch as wired vs wireless or mesh vs leatherette ear cups. So overall, functions as a wireless headset, but I much prefer the wired G432 for its better sound quality and adjustablity.

reviews.title: Issues with the flip down to unmute mic function
reviews.review_text: I would've rated this 5 stars but I have a few concerns/issues regarding this headset and I'm hoping the manufacturer/merchant sees this review and offers help. My first concern is that there were no written instructions or any kind of paperwork/manual in the box; it just contained the headset with the headband, USB receiver and the charging cord, no user documentation as it states on the box. My second concern is that when I am using the headset for work (windows 11 PC) it works great for the most part but my mic is muted even though it is flipped down. Now this is an intermittent issue but a critical issue as I am an inbound call center rep and the issue has occurred at the beginning of receiving a call. I use it with the avaya software as well as Microsoft teams, my mic gets muted when flipped down regardless of the software I'm using at the time. The only “fix” I have found is to flip the mic back up, wait a second and then flip it back down and it'll then unmute. Other than these 2 concerns, the headset is super comfortable - I wear glasses and rarely feel discomfort, it has great audio quality and noise cancellation for both the mic and earpieces. I really like this headset, I can see myself using it for a long time; I just need to find a way to fix the mic muting issue!

reviews.title: Meh
reviews.review_text: Sound is ok, main problem is the quality of the headset itself. It picks up literally any background noise even if rhings are quiet. plus many times the mute function doesnt work. Its 50/50 on wether it does or not. I would pass on these if I needed another headset

reviews.title: So far the best gaming headset I have right now!
reviews.review_text: I'll try something new with my review format and try to "categorize" things to make this more readable. Audio: The audio is good for a "gaming headset". I say this because headphones made by gaming companies don't offer superior audio compared to headsets made by actual audio companies. But the audio in these are great. Good enough bass, EQ, volume, etc. Again, nothing groundbreaking, but unless you're downgrading from an expensive set, you should be satisfied with the sound quality of these. Controls: The controls are great and straightforward. You have a volume dial on the side and an adjustable microphone. The volume dial is great in that it changes the volume on the device you're connected to, not the volume of the headset itself. This means you don't have two different volumes on both the device and the headphones, you just have one single volume. This is great for convenience, as it means no more fiddling with my Windows volume and headphones volume, it's all set to just one single volume. Build quality: In order to achieve its lightweightness, it had to use materials that are also light as well. This means it will feel "cheap", like a "toy". But it's because of the light plastic and build design. So I can get why people may see it this way, but it personally feels just fine to me. It feels sturdy enough that I don't mind it. And when it comes to it, you really have only two options: Lighter headset, but less premium feel, or heavier headset, but more premium feel. In this case, I prefer a headset that doesn't weigh much, so I'm willing to accept the build quality. The straps and ear cushions feel great as well, and are quite soft without being too soft or too firm. Microphone: The microphone has a great feature where if you put it up, it auto disables itself, and vice versa. The quality is... Not great. If you want professional quality and sound, get an actual standalone mic. Most headset mics, regardless of company, will sound subpar in comparison. But if you don't mind that, then this will suffice. The communication is clear enough in my opinion, and teammates will be able to easily hear you without too much noise or diminished quality. Wireless aspect: It uses a USB. This is an upside and a downside. The upside: You get way less latency. The downside: You don't get Bluetooth. So if your desired device won't take USB, then you basically can't use these with them. Battery life: Lasts me a good amount of time. I can go days without charging it, and I use it a lot daily for videos, music, etc. at around 75% volume. It also has a battery saving feature where it can auto shutoff when it detects it's not in use, which is pretty neat. Overall: Great if you want a light, wireless headset from a reputable brand and don't mind any of the minor downsides that come with it. I recommend purchasing if it's in your budget and you are interested at this point.

reviews.title: Light weight and great quality Sound!
reviews.review_text: Light weight and great quality drivers. Battery lasts me more than 3 days where I'm playing 4-5 ours a day and even then battery still has enough juice to keep going for another 2 days.... I just put them on charge as force of habit. Check out Rtings.com website for a detail review, these have great sound quality for music and games and the sound profile on these is similar to the G-Pro series.

reviews.title: they seem good, but arrived without a box?
reviews.review_text: I just got these today. The sound was good, the headset is comfortable. I'm just... a little confused about why they came out of the box. The packing slip says "New headphones G535". If you look at the part where it says "Item, Description", under Item, it says g535-White-Restored. But I didn't buy restored headphones? I paid for new headphones... I double checked the listing I bought from, and it is Logitech, but sold by "Elegant Electronics" and "Fulfilled by Walmart", but on the packing slip, it shows it was sent by Electronics Plus? Normally this is something I would let go, but I'm confused about why they came out of the box, is HANDWRITTEN as "new headphones" but says "G353-White-Restored" on the packing slip. They're also a little scuffed up in some places and dirty?
my husband got these for gaming. he loves them. theyre very nice headphones !
